article.headline: Columbia 55, Lehigh 54
article.story: BETHLEHEM, Pa. (AP) -- Niko Smith hit two free throws with 0.4 seconds left to give Columbia a 55-54 victory over Lehigh on Tuesday night, snapping the Mountain Hawks' nine-game home winning streak. John Baumann shot 4-for-6 from 3-point range and finished with 12 points and six rebounds for Columbia (8-5), which rallied from a six-point halftime deficit. Kyle Neptune scored 13 points and Marquise Hall added 11 for Lehigh (5-11). Lehigh, which led 26-18 at the break, had its lead cut to four points at 17:21 of the second half. Joseph Bova (eight points) hit a jumper at 11:05 to pull Columbia within a point, but Lehigh rebounded by scoring seven straight points and took a 47-39 lead with 8:27 left. Columbia stayed in contention and, after a late defensive stop by Lehigh, Scott grabbed the rebound, put up a shot and was fouled. Scott hit both free throws and Phil Anderson's desperation shot as time expired missed the mark for Lehigh.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
